fullForm: Common University Entrance Test for Postgraduate

applicationFees.general: ₹1200 (for up to 2 test papers in a slot)
applicationFees.obc: ₹900 (for up to 2 test papers in a slot)
applicationFees.sc_st: ₹800 (for up to 2 test papers in a slot)

eligibility: Candidates must have a Bachelor’s degree in the relevant discipline from a recognized university. Specific eligibility criteria may vary by programme. Final-year students can also apply.
subjectsTested: Varies by programme (e.g., English, Economics, Political Science, International Relations, Life Sciences, etc.)
negativeMarking: Yes (1 mark deducted for each incorrect answer)

faqs.question: How do I apply for JNU PG admission via CUET PG?
faqs.answer: Eligible candidates must register and appear for CUET PG conducted by NTA, select JNU as a preferred university, and participate in JNU’s counselling process using their CUET PG scores.[2][3]
